author: Hadlee Simons
title: Acer reveals Android gaming tablet
text:
Acer reveals Android gaming tablet Article By: Hadlee Simons Wed, 02 Sep 2015 6:27 PM Share The Acer Predator 8. 
It might not have physical control inputs, but Acer has revealed a gaming-focused Android tablet. 
The company revealed the Predator 8 tablet at IFA this week, in a partnership with mobile developer Gameloft. 
The tablet is packing some heat in the form of a very capable Intel Atom X7 processor (with Intel HD graphics), 2GBs of RAM, 32/64GBs of expandable storage and an 8-inch 1920x1200 display. 
In an interesting omission, the device doesn't appear to allow game-streaming from PC, as is the case with the Nvidia Shield Tablet. 
In other words, if you're looking for an ultimate gaming tablet, the Shield Tablet is still looking like a better deal. 
The Predator 8 will hit the EMEA region in October, with prices starting at â‚¬349. 
However, those looking for a powerful phone should keep an eye on the just-announced Predator 6 smartphone. 
This gaming-focused handset will ship with MediaTek's new ten core processor, 4GBs of RAM and a 21MP camera. Read More
